item.title: Iran warns it will retaliate if US attacks, as hundreds killed in protests
item.description: President Trump said on Sunday that the US military was considering "very strong options" in Iran.

item.title: Thousands of tourists stranded in Lapland as cold grounds flights
item.description: All flights out of Kittila airport in northern Finland were cancelled on Sunday with temperatures falling as low as -38C.

item.title: Sudan's government returns to capital after nearly 3 years of war
item.description: The military-backed government is back in Khartoum after being driven out by its paramilitary rival.

item.title: Thousands march and dozens arrested in Minneapolis protests against ICE
item.description: Days after the death of Renee Good, protests continue in Minneapolis and cities across the US.

item.title: Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal, before it is too late'
item.description: Trump has been turning his attention to Cuba since US forces seized Venezuelan leader Nicol√°s Maduro.
